result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Brian A Medek was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock Device shall be installed prior to defendant obtaining a valid driver's license or occupational license. However, the length of Ignition Interlock Device will begin when a valid driver's license or occupational license has been issued. (Call Department of Motor Vehicles with questions).

miscConds.notes: $1,694.00 fine/cost to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office.  Bond to be applied to all fines/costs.  If there is a remaining balance still due, Defendant is to make payments of $100.00 per month beginning 1/1/2017, and due on the first of each month thereafter until paid in full.

$250.00 DNA surcharge to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office.  Bond to be applied to all fines/costs.  If there is a remaining balance still due, Defendant is to make payments of $100.00 per month beginning 1/1/2017, and due on the first of each month thereafter until paid in full.
Subject to Work Release after the first 48 hours.  Subject to Good Time.
May not possess or use firearms.
Not to have ABUSIVE contact with Lorena or James Klassen.
Must complete an AODA assessment & comply with recommendations.

timeConds.notes:
6 months to be served upfront - must report no later than 8/26/16, at 5:00 pm.
6 months stayed for use by Probation if necessary.

records.addlTxt: Remaining Bond applied to fine/cost in 16CF143
Associated with Charge #1

15CF269 & 16CF143, 15TR1451  JP-clerk.  11:42 a.m. Defendant Brian A Medek in court with attorney Donna Berger for Brian Smestad.  Daniel Joseph Tolan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   DE S&T.  Ct finds DE FVI&K makes pleas.  11:58 adj. 

15TR1451 - Dismissed
15CF269 - DE pleads G.  Ct finds DE Guilty on Count 1.  and enters JOC.  Merging and dismissing Count 2 
16CF143 - DE pleads G to count 3.  Ct accepts G Plea to Count 3.  Counts 1&2 dismissed outright.

State in compliance with VR.  

SENTENCING:  
15CF269 - Ct accepts JR of counsel.  Court withholds sentence.  Probation 3 years.  DE to report to probation today.  Condition of probation is 1 year in county jail.  6 months up front, balance of 6 months to be stayed.  subject to good time, huber after 48 hours.  no abusive contact with Reina & James Klassen.  24 month loss of operating priv. 2 years IID, AODA assessment and comply.  Fine/costs of $1694.00.  Bond to be applied to fines.  If bond does not pay in full, $100/mo PP beginning 1-1-2017.  No firearm possession.  Ct gives DE until 8-26-16 no later than 5 p.m. to report to jail  Sentence credit of 8 days.  DE to provide DNA sample and $250.00 surcharge to be paid to COCC.  

16CF143 - fine 265.60, plus $200 DNA surcharge.
Plea hearing on August 19, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Report in support of probable cause for arrest. Request for criminal complaint
